Sequence Information.Peptide Name: NKL-24 (H2 and H3 helices of SapB domain, fragment of NK-lysin, synthetic AMPs20; XXA; BBMm, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: a fragment of Zebrafish NK-lysin, Yesso scallop,Patinopecten yessoensis

Literature.Author: Shan Z, Yang Y, Guan N, Xia X, Liu W.
Literature.Title: NKL-24: A novel antimicrobial peptide derived from zebrafish NK-lysin that inhibits bacterial growth and enhances resistance against Vibrio parahaemolyticus infection in Yesso scallop, Patinopecten yessoensis

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (40%) toHp1090. Predicted to be helical.Activity: Active against Gram- V. parahaemolyticus 1.1616/ATCC 33847 (MIC 10 uM).AMP Significance: The V. parahaemolyticus pathogen causes scallop disease and may be treated by this peptide.MOA:bacteria:V. parahaemolyticus: membrane permeation.Antivirulence:bacteria:V. parahaemolyticus:  Sub-lethal levels of NKL-24 obviously reduced bacterial swimming ability and downregulated the transcription of the selected genes associated with bacterial virulence.In vitro toxicity: It is not toxic to hemocytes of scallops till 100 uM.Animal model:scallops: Survival experiment: compared to the control (20% survived), 60% scallops survived either pretreatment before infection or treatment after infection via injection of 20 ug in 4h or 5 ug in  2 h. Both treatment time and dose played a role here.Updated 12/2024
